conditions.name: Lp(a) Eligibility Criteria
conditions.text: Participants with Lp(a) <175 nmol/L at Visit 1 will not be eligible for enrollment, despite their values in prescreening

conditions.name: High Risk for Cardiovascular Events
conditions.description: Definition of high cardiovascular risk status
conditions.text: High risk for cardiovascular events will be defined as CAD, stroke, or peripheral artery disease, or ASCVD risk equivalents (familial hypercholesterolemia or type 2 diabetes)

conditions.name: Fasting Requirement
conditions.text: Participants are required to fast before Visits 1-12. If a participant arrives not fasted, schedule the laboratory draw for another date

conditions.name: HCV Positive Follow-up
conditions.description: Additional testing required if HCV antibody positive
conditions.text: If HCV antibody test is positive, it must be followed by an HCV RNA test

conditions.name: HBV Screening Follow-up
conditions.description: Additional testing for hepatitis B status
conditions.text: If HBsAg is negative and HBcAb is positive, further testing with HBV DNA is required. If the screening HBV DNA is negative, the participant is not excluded

conditions.name: FSH Testing Condition
conditions.description: Optional FSH testing for postmenopausal confirmation
conditions.text: Optional; performed as needed to confirm postmenopausal status

transitionRules.name: Prescreening to Screening Transition
transitionRules.text: If the participant has not had Lp(a) measured before or is unknown, the prescreening visit should be completed. Central laboratory testing for Lp(a) is still required as part of the screening procedures conducted at Visit 1

transitionRules.name: Screening to Treatment Transition
transitionRules.text: Inclusion and exclusion criteria should be confirmed prior to drug assignment and administration of first dose of study intervention. All procedures (screening and baseline) need to be completed prior to the first dose of study intervention

transitionRules.name: Prescreening Repeat Rule
transitionRules.text: The optional prescreening visit can be repeated 1 time (no more) per participant if the investigator believes the participant would meet criteria at a later time, with a minimum of 4 weeks between visits. Repeated sampling in the prescreening visit will not require re-consenting or assignment of a new participant identification number

transitionRules.name: Early Discontinuation from Study Intervention
transitionRules.text: For an early discontinuation (ED) from the study intervention that occurs before the last visit in treatment period, see the activities listed for ED in this table

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Early Discontinuation
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Early discontinuation from study intervention before the last visit in treatment period triggers ED visit procedures

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Completion of Visit 12 (Day 540) with all protocol-required assessments

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lp(a) Screening Failure
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Participants with Lp(a) <175 nmol/L at Visit 1 will not be eligible for enrollment

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Lp(a) Eligibility Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point at Visit 1 to determine if participant meets Lp(a) eligibility threshold of â‰¥175 nmol/L

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Prescreening Repeat Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point to determine if prescreening should be repeated based on investigator assessment that participant may meet criteria at a later time

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: HCV Follow-up Testing Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point to determine if HCV RNA testing is required based on positive HCV antibody result

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: HBV Follow-up Testing Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point to determine if HBV DNA testing is required based on HBsAg negative and HBcAb positive results

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Fasting Status Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point at each visit to determine if laboratory draw can proceed based on fasting status
